required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: FIRE AND ICE Re-Ablations (Retrospective Data Collection)
clinical_study.official_title: FIRE AND ICE Re-Ablations: Retrospective Data Collection on Re-ablations Performed Within the FIRE AND ICE Trial

lead_sponsor.agency: Medtronic Cardiac Rhythm and Heart Failure

clinical_study.source: Medtronic Cardiac Rhythm and Heart Failure

brief_summary.textblock: Retrospective data collection on re-ablations performed within the FIRE AND ICE Trial.

detailed_description.textblock: The purpose of this retrospective data collection on re-ablations performed in both treatment arms (Cryo arm and Radiofrequency arm) of the FIRE AND ICE Trial is to gain insight into re-occurrence of atrial arrhythmias resulting in a re-ablation after a performed index ablation procedure. Data to be collected from subject charts include pulmonary vein anatomy, documented atrial arrhythmias prior to re-ablation, pulmonary vein reconnection, pulmonary vein ablation lesion gaps and gap location, ablation lesions performed during the re-ablation, procedure parameters of the RF or cryo catheter utilized during the re-ablation, and success of re-ablations performed.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Documented Atrial Arrhythmias Prior to Re-ablation
primary_outcome.description: Number of documented atrial arrhythmias as assessed by ECG prior to the re-ablation

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Reconnected Pulmonary Veins as Documented in the Cath Lab / Imaging at the Time of Re-ablation Procedure
primary_outcome.description: Number of reconnected pulmonary veins as documented in cath lab / imaging

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Gaps and Location of Gaps Present in Pulmonary Vein Ablation Lesions Per Participant
primary_outcome.description: Number of gaps and location of gaps present in pulmonary vein ablation lesions as seen in the cath lab / imaging

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Pulmonary Veins Ablation - Ablation Lesion Sets Created During Re-ablation Procedure
primary_outcome.description: Description of all ablation lesion sets created during re-ablation procedure

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Acute Procedural Success of Re-ablation Procedure
primary_outcome.description: Summarize acute procedural success of re-ablation procedure per treatment arm

primary_outcome.measure: Re-ablation Procedure Times as Measured in the Cath Lab
primary_outcome.description: Re-ablation procedure times as measured in the cath lab

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Hospital Days for Re-ablation Procedure Form Admission to Discharge
primary_outcome.time_frame: From Date of Hospital admission until the date of hospital discharge up to 36 month FU period
primary_outcome.description: Number of hospital days for re-ablation procedure form admission to discharge

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Anti-arrhythmic Drug Use at Time of Discharge From the Re-ablation Procedure
primary_outcome.time_frame: Date of hospital discharge, assessed during the 36 month FU period
primary_outcome.description: Anti-arrhythmic drug use at time of discharge from the re-ablation procedure via medical log on AADs

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participatns With Adenosine Testing
primary_outcome.description: Number of participants with adenosine testing

arm_group.arm_group_label: Cryoballoon Arm from FIRE AND ICE Trial
arm_group.description: No new/additional patients will be enrolled within this project. Only retrospective data will be collected on performed re-ablation procedures within the FIRE AND ICE Trial. The FIRE AND ICE Trial collected data to compare efficacy and safety of isolation of the pulmonary veins (PV) using a Cryoballoon catheter versus (Cryoballoon Arm) a radiofrequency ablation (RF Arm) with a ThermoCool catheter in patients with drug refractory symptomatic paroxysmal atrial fibrillation (AF). Products Used within the FIRE AND ICE Trial: Arctic Front速 & Arctic Front Advance速 Cardiac CryoAblation Catheter System. The purpose of this retrospective data collection on re-ablations performed in both treatment arms (Cryo arm and Radiofrequency arm) of the FIRE AND ICE Trial.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Radiofrequency Arm from FIRE AND ICE Trial
arm_group.description: No new/additional patients will be enrolled within this project. Only retrospective data will be collected on performed re-ablation procedures within the FIRE AND ICE Trial. Products Used within the FIRE AND ICE Trial: NaviStar速 ThermoCool速 Ablation Catheter (Radiofrequency Arm; Manufacturer Biosense Webster, Inc.). The purpose of this retrospective data collection on re-ablations performed in both treatment arms (Cryo arm and Radiofrequency arm) of the FIRE AND ICE Trial.

intervention.description: No new patients will be enrolled within this project; only retrospective data will be collected on performed re-ablations within the FIRE AND ICE Trial
intervention.arm_group_label: Cryoballoon Arm from FIRE AND ICE Trial
Radiofrequency Arm from FIRE AND ICE Trial

study_pop.textblock: The FIRE AND ICE Trial collected data to compare efficacy and safety of isolation of the pulmonary veins (PV) using a Cryoballoon catheter versus a radiofrequency ablation with a ThermoCool catheter in patients with drug refractory symptomatic paroxysmal atrial fibrillation (PAF).

criteria.textblock:
N/A - no new patients will be enrolled within this project.
Inclusion Criteria for the FIRE AND ICE Trial included:
- Symptomatic paroxysmal atrial fibrillation (PAF) with at least two episodes and at least one episode documented (30 seconds episode length, documented by electrocardiogram (ECG) within last 12 months
- Documented treatment failure for effectiveness of at least one anti-arrythmic drug (AAD Type I or III, including Beta-Blocker and AAD intolerance)
- 18 to 75 years of age
- Patients who are mentally and linguistically able to understand the aim of the trial and to show sufficient compliance in following the trial protocol
- Patient is able to verbally acknowledge and understand the associated risks, benefits, and treatment alternatives to therapeutic options of this trial: cryoballoon ablation system or standard radiofrequency (RF) ablation technique.
The exclusion criteria were grouped as follows in the FIRE AND ICE Trial:
- General exclusion criteria
- Exclusion criteria related to the cardiac condition
- Exclusion criteria based on laboratory abnormalities

facility.name: Hospital Clinico Universitario Virgen de la Victoria

link.description: CircEP - FIRE AND ICE Re-Ablation Manuscript

participant_flow.recruitment_details: 110 patients reported a re-ablation in the original FIRE AND ICE Trial. Of those 110, 89 consented for the FIRE AND ICE Re-Ablation study. All data available in retrospective chart review from the 89 subjects were included in analyses. No patient data was excluded. The first re-ablation for each patient was included in the analysis.

Products Used within the FIRE AND ICE Trial: NaviStar速 ThermoCool速 Ablation Catheter (Radiofrequency Arm; Manufacturer Biosense Webster, Inc.). The purpose of this retrospective data collection on re-ablations performed in both treatment arms (Cryo arm and Radiofrequency arm) of the FIRE AND ICE Trial. No interventions - retrospective data collection: No new patients will be enrolled within this project; only retrospective data will be collected on performed re-ablations within the FIRE AND ICE Trial

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: Race and Ethnicity Not Collected
measure.population: Race and Ethnicity were not collected from any participant.

measure.title: New York Heart Association (NYHA) Class
measure.description: The New York Heart Association (NYHA) Functional Classification provides a way of classifying the extent of heart failure. NYHA I - No limiation of phyiscal activity. NYHA II - Slight limiation of phyiscial activity. NYHA III - Marked limiation of physical activity. NYHA IV - Unable to carry on any physical activity without discomfort. Within FIRE AND ICE Re-Do the majorty of patients 69% does not have heart failure signs. If any signs of heart failure documented in the baseline, then only mild forms. No heart failure patients (NYHA III or IV) were seen/enrolled in FIRE AND ICE Re-Do.

category.title: Patient does not have heart failure

measure.title: Left Atrial Diameter (LAD) [mm]
measure.description: Left Atrial Diameter was measured within the trial. An anteroposterior left atrial diameter of more than 55 mm as measured by trans-thoracic echocardiography is an exclusion criteria within the inital FIRE AND ICE Trial (outcome of ablation in patients with significant atrial dilation > 55 mm is lacking data but is seen as possible predictor for pulmonary vein isolation failure/atrial fibrillation recurrence).

measure.title: Left Ventricular Ejection Fraction (LVEF) [%]
measure.description: The ejection fraction (EF) is a measurement, expressed as percentage, of how much blood the left ventricle pumps out with each contraction, e.g. an ejection fraction of 60% means that 60% of the total amount of blood in the left ventricle is pushed out with each heartbeat. Therefore the ejection fraction is an indcation of how well the heart is pumping and may be an evidence of heart failure (under 40%) or cardiomyopathy.

measure.title: HATCH Score
measure.description: The HATCH score stratifies patients with paroxysmal atrial fibrillation according to their risk for progression of sustained atrial fibrillation within 1-year. The HATCH score is an ordinal scale ranging from 0 to 7 points and is calculated based on the following formula: 1x (Hypertension) + 1 x (Age >75years) + 2 x (Transient Ischemic Attack or Stroke) + 1x (Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease) + 2x (Heart Failure). Higher HATCH score is seen in literature as increased risk for progression of sustained atrial fibrillation.

measure.title: CHA2DS2-VASc
measure.description: CHA2DS2-VASc Score for Atrial Fibrillation Stroke Risk. Score is between 0 and 9 points: 1 point - Congestive Heart Failure 1 point - Hypertension 2 point - Age > 75 years point - Diabetes mellitus point - Stroke / Transient Ischemic Attach / Thromboembolic Event 1 point - Vascular Disease (prior myocardial infarction, peripheral artery disease, or aortic plaque) 1 point - Age 65 to 74 years 1 point - Sex category (i.e. female sex) A high score is the same as a higher stroke risk, and a low score means the lower stroke risk.

outcome.title: Number of Pulmonary Veins Ablation - Ablation Lesion Sets Created During Re-ablation Procedure
outcome.description: Description of all ablation lesion sets created during re-ablation procedure
outcome.population: The number of lesion sets for each patient was counted for this objective. If a patient had multiple pulmonary veins ablated during the re-ablation procedure, each pulmonary vein was counted as a lesion set towards the patients total count.

measure.title: Number of Pulmonary Veins Ablation - Ablation Lesion Sets Created During Re-ablation Procedure
measure.description: Description of all ablation lesion sets created during re-ablation procedure

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Acute Procedural Success of Re-ablation Procedure
outcome.description: Summarize acute procedural success of re-ablation procedure per treatment arm
outcome.population: A patient was defined as an acute success if all ablation attempts within the re-ablation procedure were reported as successful. Pulmonary Vein Isolation (PVI) was assessed minimally via documented entrance block, and where assessable exit block (electrical signal detection).

The FIRE AND ICE Trial collected data to compare efficacy and safety of isolation of the pulmonary veins (PV) using a Cryoballoon catheter versus (Cryoballoon Arm) a radiofrequency ablation (RF Arm) with a ThermoCool catheter in patients with drug refractory symptomatic paroxysmal atrial fibrillation (AF). Products Used within the FIRE AND ICE Trial: Arctic Front速 & Arctic Front Advance速 Cardiac CryoAblation Catheter System. The purpose of this retrospective data collection on re-ablations performed in both treatment arms (Cryo arm and Radiofrequency arm) of the FIRE AND ICE Trial. No interventions - retrospective data collection: No new patients will be enrolled within this project; only retrospective data will be collected on performed re-ablations within the FIRE AND ICE Trial

measure.title: Number of Participants With Anti-arrhythmic Drug Use at Time of Discharge From the Re-ablation Procedure
measure.description: Anti-arrhythmic drug use at time of discharge from the re-ablation procedure via medical log on AADs

outcome.title: Number of Participatns With Adenosine Testing
outcome.description: Number of participants with adenosine testing

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Publications from this retrospective data collection are regulated separately in the publication plan, which was reviewed and approved by the Publication Committee. Medical Centers / Investigators may publish the results of work performed under the applicable site agreement. Any such publication shall be at a time determined by Medtronic and shall be provided to Medtronic for review at least 60 days prior to submission or presentation.
